Summarize Power Analysis Simulation Results

Source: R/compute_measures.R
summarize_sims.Rd

This function aggregates raw simulation results across multiple runs to compute summary statistics including power estimates, parameter estimates, convergence metrics, and Monte Carlo standard errors.

Usage

summarize_sims(results_df_raw, n_sims)

Arguments

results_df_raw

A data frame containing raw simulation results with columns:

  • id_cond: Condition identifier

  • parameter: Parameter name

  • threshold_success: Success threshold for the parameter

  • threshold_futility: Futility threshold for the parameter

  • success_prob: Probability of success for each simulation

  • futility_prob: Probability of futility for each simulation

  • sig_success: Binary success significance indicator

  • sig_futility: Binary futility significance indicator

  • est_median: Posterior median estimates

  • est_mad: Posterior median absolute deviation

  • est_mean: Posterior mean estimates

  • est_sd: Posterior standard deviation

  • rhat: R-hat convergence diagnostic

  • ess_bulk: Bulk effective sample size

  • ess_tail: Tail effective sample size

  • converged: Convergence status indicator

  • error: Error messages (if any)

n_sims

Integer specifying the total number of simulations run

Value

A data frame with summarized results grouped by condition and parameter, containing mean estimates and Monte Carlo standard errors (SE) for all metrics:

  • Probability estimates: prob_success, prob_futility

  • Power estimates: power_success, power_futility

  • Parameter estimates: median, mean, mad, sd

  • Convergence metrics: rhat, ess_bulk, ess_tail, conv_rate

Each metric includes corresponding _se columns with standard errors.

Details

The function groups results by condition ID, parameter, and thresholds, then computes:

  • Mean values across simulations for all continuous metrics

  • Power as the proportion of simulations meeting significance criteria

  • Convergence rate as the proportion of successfully converged simulations

  • Monte Carlo standard errors for uncertainty quantification

  • Concatenated error messages for debugging purposes

See also

compute_measures_brmsfit()
